overview: From 2026-02-01 to 2026-03-01, elizaos-plugins/plugin-evm had 1 new PRs (2 merged), 0 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: multi-provider RPC (Alchemy, Infura, Ankr, Eliza Cloud)
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
## Summary - Adds multi-provider RPC abstraction supporting Alchemy (29 chains), Infura (27 chains), Ankr (25 chains), and Eliza Cloud proxy (32 chains) - `EVM_RPC_PROVIDER` setting selects preferred provider with automatic fallback - Per-chain custom RPC overrides always take highest priority - Startup validation warns when no provider is configured - Adds `ALCHEMY_API_KEY`, `INFURA_API_KEY`, `ANKR_API_KEY` to pluginParameters schema ## Test plan - [x] 45 unit tests covering URL construction, priority ordering, fallback, edge cases - [x] 16 live integration tests against real Alchemy endpoints (ETH mainnet, Base verified) - [x] All tests pass: `bun vitest run __tests__/unit/ __tests__/integration/` Made with [Cursor](https://cursor.com)

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds a robust multi-provider RPC abstraction layer that supports Alchemy (29 chains), Infura (27 chains), Ankr (25 chains), and Eliza Cloud proxy (32 chains). The implementation provides automatic fallback when a preferred provider doesn't support a specific chain, while maintaining backward compatibility with per-chain custom RPC URLs. **Key changes:** - New `rpc-providers.ts` module with provider factory pattern and chain mapping - `EVM_RPC_PROVIDER` setting for provider preference with automatic fallback - Priority ordering: custom RPC URLs > preferred provider > other providers > viem defaults - Startup validation with helpful warnings when no provider is configured - 45 unit tests and 16 live integration tests with 100% pass rate **Minor issue:** - Custom RPC URLs are incorrectly labeled as `"alchemy"` provider in logs (line 256 of `rpc-providers.ts`), which could cause confusion during debugging. Consider adding `"custom"` to the `RPCProviderName` type union.

Confidence Score: 4/5

- Safe to merge with one minor logging inconsistency that doesn't affect functionality - Strong implementation with comprehensive test coverage (61 total tests), proper error handling, and clean architecture. The only issue is cosmetic - custom RPC URLs are mislabeled in logs. No breaking changes, security issues, or logic errors detected. - typescript/rpc-providers.ts - address the custom RPC provider name labeling issue

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | typescript/rpc-providers.ts | New multi-provider RPC abstraction with support for Alchemy, Infura, Ankr, and Eliza Cloud. Minor issue: custom RPC URLs incorrectly labeled as "alchemy" provider in logs. | | typescript/providers/wallet.ts | Integrates new RPC provider manager into wallet initialization. Clean refactoring that replaces direct environment variable reads with centralized provider resolution. | | typescript/__tests__/unit/rpc-providers.test.ts | Comprehensive unit tests covering provider resolution, fallback logic, priority ordering, and edge cases. 45 test cases provide excellent coverage. |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Runtime as IAgentRuntime participant Wallet as WalletProvider participant Manager as RPCProviderManager participant Providers as Provider Configs Wallet->>Runtime: validateRPCProviderConfig() Runtime-->>Wallet: {valid, providers, warnings} Wallet->>Manager: initRPCProviderManager(runtime) Manager->>Runtime: getSetting("EVM_RPC_PROVIDER") Runtime-->>Manager: preferred provider Manager->>Runtime: getSetting("ALCHEMY_API_KEY") Manager->>Runtime: getSetting("INFURA_API_KEY") Manager->>Runtime: getSetting("ANKR_API_KEY") Manager->>Runtime: getSetting("ELIZAOS_CLOUD_*") Manager->>Providers: create configured providers Providers-->>Manager: provider configs array Manager->>Manager: sort by preference & chain coverage Manager-->>Wallet: RPCProviderManager instance loop for each chain Wallet->>Manager: resolveForChain(chainName) Manager->>Runtime: check custom RPC (ETHEREUM_PROVIDER_*) alt has custom RPC Manager-->>Wallet: {providerName, rpcUrl, headers} else no custom RPC Manager->>Providers: find first provider supporting chain Providers->>Providers: buildUrl(chainName, apiKey) Providers-->>Manager: RPC URL Manager-->>Wallet: {providerName, rpcUrl, headers} end Wallet->>Wallet: genChainFromName(chainName, rpcUrl) end ```

topPRs.title: Spartan-Intel work
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Integrates with Spartan-Intel chain registry and overhauls EVMService to add wallet/key ops, validation/signing, balances/portfolio, transfers, DEX registry, and multicall batching; plus provider optimization and logging tweaks.
> 
> - **EVM Plugin (`src/index.ts`)**:
>   - Integrates with `spartan-intel` by awaiting `INTEL_CHAIN` service and registering EVM chains (`eth`, `base`).
> - **Service (`src/service.ts`) â€“ Major expansion**:
>   - Adds wallet/key management (`createWallet`, `getPubkeysFromSecrets`, private key detection).
>   - Address ops: detection, validation, and type inference via bytecode checks.
>   - Message signing/verification using `viem`.
>   - Balances/Portfolio: batched native balance reads; CAIP asset parsing; portfolio aggregation.
>   - Transfers: native token transfers (ERC20 TODO).
>   - DEX integration: exchange registry (`registerExchange`, `listExchanges`, `doSwapOnExchange`).
>   - Multicall3 batch executor and ERC20 balance helper; public client with HTTP batching.
>   - Chain registry utilities via `viem/chains`; improved runtime-based logging; refactored static `start/stop`.
> - **Providers**:
>   - `get-balance`: short-circuits when no message text to avoid model calls.
>   - `wallet`: improved log messages and fallback handling; unchanged external API.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit b329b3eb1f1e2ac8f0ab8c8d78850352747adadd. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Release Notes

* **New Features**
  * Added wallet creation and key management capabilities
  * Implemented address validation and type detection
  * Added message signing and verification functionality
  * Enable multi-wallet balance and portfolio retrieval
  * Support for native token transfers
  * Pluggable DEX/exchange provider integration
  * Enhanced multi-chain support

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved performance by skipping unnecessary processing for empty messages

* **Chores**
  * Updated logging system integration
  * Refined plugin description

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topContributors.summary: 0xbbjoker: Focused on maintenance and stability by addressing technical debt through targeted bugfix work. They contributed a single commit that modified three files, resulting in a balanced set of nine additions and eight deletions. This activity reflects a precise approach to resolving existing issues within the codebase. Their primary focus for the month was dedicated entirely to bugfix efforts across various file types.
